basics.name: Diijon Taylor
basics.label: Software Engineer
basics.summary: Disciplined and passionate developer interested in making software that exceeds expectations and offers unquestionable value. I have more than ten years of experience working with web technologies.

work.summary: Surge hires only remote senior developers to deliver custom software to a diverse range of industries
highlights: UnderArmour.com microarchitecture/uarch developer including ReactJS, Angular front-end projects and highly scalable NodeJS REST APIs
Built ETL solution using SSIS and stored procedures to migrate several Oracle Databases into a SQL Server Database
Lead Systems Architect for an electronic health records system (EHR)

work.summary: City Corridor develops and maintains a secure distributed sales and advertising platform
highlights: Built a multi-tenant custom content management system with an ASP.Net MVC, SQL Server back-end, and KnockoutJS front-end
Built a REST API ETL solution that imports data from multiple partners and data sources (xml, json) into a SQL Server database
Developed NodeJS ad-hoc reporting application accessible with a REST API

work.summary: Unisys Federal Systems develops software applications to assist government agencies in data-mining, budget analysis, inventory tracking, and document management
highlights: Developed a highly computational SSIS ETL solution to support budget analysis
Developed Common Access Card (CAC)-Authenticated user management software with ASP.Net WebForms
Developed budgeting solution for managing $1 billion+ assets with ASP.Net MVC, jQuery, and Entity Framework

work.summary: Tidewater Finance Company provides assistance to consumers purchasing goods by building direct relationships with retail and automobile merchants
highlights: Rebranding of online presence for 3 websites, providing self-service account tools for 50,000+ accounts
Developed the online presence for a retirement community website featuring a custom XML-based content management system
Technologies & Skills: Web Development with ASP.Net Webforms, SOAP WebServices, jQuery, CSS, Microsoft SQL Server, SSIS, Graphic Design

work.summary: The City of Virginia Beach ComIT department is responsible for delivering technology solutions to all City of Virginia Beach departments and citizens
highlights: Developed XML-based Adobe Flash training tools and games featuring custom XML-based content management systems
Lead redesign of several high-traffic websites and assisted team members in web development
Technologies & Skills: Web Development with ASP.Net Webforms, SOAP WebServices, JavaScript, CSS, Microsoft SQL Server, Graphic Design

interests.name: Madden NFL Football, Augmented Reality aka The Future!!!
